Summary: I have stayed here for business projects and it is the best deal in town.  Rooms have frig and microwave oven for food/beverage, and staff are accommodating for various requests.  It is ideal located off the 405 freeway on Harbor and plenty of food options and grocery within walking distance.  Walikng distance to Hooters.

This place needs to be shut down. I think they are paying people for positive reviews.  I stayed here a few years ago and it was not this bad. When I tried to contact corporate both numbers listed online did not work. There were roaches and some kind of jumping bug I’ve never seen before. The older female that checked me in was rude. I asked to check in early and she said nothing was available. When I said that I’d like to cancel there was a room available. There was a bug on the sheet on the bed and when I asked housekeeping to change it she just gave me a look and seemed like she didn’t speak English. I went to take the sheets off and underneath there was a bunch of food and trash. A different housekeeper came and changed the mattress cover and sheets but there were so many
Room tip: I paid almost $200 for a room with an array of different insects. There is not a good room.

Summary: Just stayed here for my first time on a business trip from Texas. Real nice place and good people. I was booked in across the street at Motel Six and didn't like it at all for its being condensed and a tad noisy. I spotted this place and gave it a try and happy I did.  Based on my own brief experience, I agree with the previous reviewer that some of the bad reviews below are so extreme and absurd and don't make any sense. Y'all should give this place a try.

This place looks ok from the outside but that is the only good thing I can say about it. It started off with bad attitude from the front desk clerk and went downhill from there. The room smelled bad and it wasn't clean. The linens were threadbare and the bed sagged in the middle. There was constant activity in the parking lot all night and I can only guess at what was going on. The Internet worked off and on and was too slow to be of any use. To top it off the front desk clerk refused to give me a bill when I checked out and just said that my credit card bill would show the charge. I would rather sleep in my car than to spend another night here. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.

I checked in... there was a guy that was sleeping in his car that tried to open my car door while I was checking in! I moved my car and went to the room. Opened the door to the worst smell. A combination of mold and piss smell came wafting out!!! Seriously... this could be the worst I have ever seen! I am not a picky person, or need a nice room... just something basic. This is an unsafe place and the room was so Disgusting... I had to leave and ask for a refund! They asked if I would like to change rooms... hell no!

First of all, I have to say I am not at all a fancy person. So when I just need a basic place to sleep for and event or function out of town, I’m always looking for deal and I’m usually good with these type of budget motels. I guess I should have known since this place was significantly cheaper than any other lodging around (including motel 6 across the street). But I figured, it’s still Costa Mess, how bad could it be? VERY BAD!!! This place is like an old run down, never updated and poorly maintained crack motel.  The room was supposed to be non smoking, but still wreaked of cigarette smoke.  It’s probably coming from the nasty, dirty old furniture that must have been there since the 70s. The TV was broken. The bathroom was dirty, and the carpets are ripped. There were weird

I spend a night in this hotel. Before my trip I read reviews, most of them was terrible and I seriously regretted but when I went to hotel, reception staff was friendly, check in took 5 min, WiFi was good enough to have an hour video call and there was no bugs. It was acceptable.

Do yourself a favor and drive by this place. The rooms smell bad sort of mouldy and stale. The rooms need a deep cleaning and an update. The furniture is beat up and old. The internet speed is reminiscent of 1990's dial up speed and shuts down periodically. The front desk was slow but friendly however they wanted to charge us a fee for showing up before 3:00 PM. Really? Just go somewhere else.

The Vagabond Inn did have above average towels, a comfortable bed and large dressing and bath area. However  the venue goes downhill from there. It can best described as California rustic. The entire inn is dated and long past its glory days of lodging. Rooms are large but furnishings show being decades old but servicable. The breakfast could barely be called basic with wrapped pastry, cereal and fruit well passed its prime. Hardly reflects on the one hundred plus dollars charged each day. The venue shares its space with a hamburger chain and is a busy driving area at all times. T.V. very limited in channels. The Vagabond Inn is OK for the male solo travelor or for those only limited to low budget in expensive Orange County summertime travel.  However families with children
Room tip: Watch out for traffic around the burger chain

Summary Heading: I didn’t know places like this exsisted still
Summary: I’m pretty easy when it comes to where I sleep... This was something special though... It took 45min just to check in because their system was supposedly down. Once we finally checked in we went to our room and was instantly smacked in the face by a smell of stale cigs and mold. We kind of laughed and tried to be positive but then we found stains on the bed, the lights were flickering, and to top it off the refrigerator was filled with wet, moldy, bunched up towels. I think we spent a total of 5min in the room before checking out. I’m currently sleeping in my car which I feel much better about than that sorry excuse for a hotel. Oh and not to mention someone asked me if I had any speed while I was walking into the lobby.

I’m pretty lenient on a lot of things and conditions.  But this motel surpassed even my comfort zone.  The bathroom was filthy and had bugs.   The staff was less than stellar.  They did accommodate my full size truck and trailer, so I’ll give them that.  But overall, this is now on my “No fly list”.  Will not stay here again.

This has been my go-to business hotel for the past year, and I just stayed again for another week.  The housekeeping staff managed by Martha is outstanding. My room is always cleaned thoroughly. Whenever I request a hair dryer or an iron, it's delivered to my room within five minutes... Five-star hotels can't match that kind of service. The front desk crew including Sharmin and Damaris does an excellent job handling check-in and check-out. The maintenance staff is friendly and helpful as well.  This hotel is also in an excellent location... The 405 highway is within a block and local restaurants - all within a block or two - include Chick-fil-a, McDonald's Pollo Loco, Denny's, Cain's Chicken, IHOP and Taco Bell. On top of all that, an excellent Target store is just two blocks

Room was moldy smelling and out dated. Was dirty so went & bought our own cleaning products. Told staff battery in detector was beeping, may need a new one, so they just tore out the whole detector from the wall!

Summary Heading: Looking for drugs and prostitues this is your place
Summary: Booked this motel through motel booking site while in line at Disney, decided to stay a few extra days and the motel we were staying at near Disney was booked solid, so found one closer to the beach, Left Disney when they closed so got to this motel after midnight, checked in and went to the room, parked in front of room got out of truck wife and sleeping kids still in truck and was greeted by a prostitute looking to keep me company said not and she went back to hanging out with the onsite "security guard" then went into room and found the room had a foul smell, the room was dirty, the lights flickered as they were shorting out, the bathroom sink had what appeared to be burns on the counter not cigarette or curling iron, my guess crack pipe or other, outside cars are in and out

Summary Heading: beware $25 fee if u try to check in before 3pm, also homeless coming from river
Summary: the owners lack of understanding of hospitality in a major city, have added a hidden fee if you try to check in before 3pm, instead of hiring more cleaning people to get rooms done on time, and contributing to the economy they are trying to extract fees hidden and not disclosed fees onto guest, does guest even can it even be used as a word if there are hidden undisclosed fees, no where on my booking was this fee disclosed before booking or after booking.   also there are homeless nearby and they seem to walk around property   beware $25 fee if u try to check in before 3pm, also homeless coming from river

This was the second worst motel experience I've had. A generous soul cannot even label this "shabby chic". It was noisy, missing light bulbs, though rented as non smoking reeked of cigarette smoke and burns in the carpet. "Breakfast " was a 220 calorie prepackaged mini pastry and bad coffee. 1970s colors. Rusting sinks, desk and furniture so beat up it was depressing.

Summary Heading: Excellant attention From Management and Staff
Summary: Property is dated but a great bargain. Attention from management and staff is excellent. Will definitely stay here again when in the area. Although the location is next to the 405 Freeway the property is relatively quiet.

Summary Heading: I needed a hair dryer to blow dry my hair
Summary: The room was very budget friendly. There was a “Manager’s discount” deal through the website, which knocked off 5%. My room didn’t have all the amenities advertised: no hair dryer, microwave or mini-fridge. The coffee maker couldn’t make coffee. And the WiFi connectivity was terrible. The WiFi is better the closer you are to the lobby.   There was also a phishing WiFi network using a similar name to the inn’s name; they should start warning customers when they check in.  Other than that, it was a great location, especially with an In N’Out right out in front.

I've stayed in this hotel numerous times over the last two months and have had numerous issues and finally decided to never go back. I stayed in room 158 about a month ago and was bitten numerous times by bugs (I thought it was a fluke and did nothing about it). I stayed there again recently in room 255 and was attacked even worse. I brought it to management's attention and they were totally disinterested and unresponsive. This is not the only issue at the hotel, there is a steady stream of people loitering around the hotel and you constantly feel unsafe. I suggest finding a different property. This is one of the cheapest places in the area and you definitely get what you pay for. Just a suggestion but, I would spend the extra 10 bucks somewhere else...I know I will moving

Summary Heading: Our Go-To Place Whenever We Vist Disneyland
Summary: Our whole family loves this place. Close enough to Disneyland to make it a quick trip to the Magic Kingdom, but far enough away to avoid the crazy high hotel prices closer to Disneyland. And located right on Interstate 405, which the locals call "the 405".  :-)  The staff is great with families and kids and our kids love the free breakfast in the hotel lobby and the swimming pool. And by the time we return from Disneyland at night, Martha and her housekeeping posse always have our room looking great. The front desk led by Sharmin is always a pleasure to deal with. What we like most about this place is that we see the same staff members every time we visit which makes it a bit of a home away from home, especially for the kids. Btw, there's an awesome In and Out burger joint right

Great place! Not to far from a lot of fun places like the beach and Disneyland and nothing can beat the In and Out in the parking lot. The room was spacious. My only concern was the top lock on the door was broken, and I had to call for my blow dryer other than that it was great!

This is a terrific hotel and we look forward to staying here again.  The front desk team - this includes Sharmin, Damariss and Vignesh - does an excellent job. All-around utility man Ramesh is always friendly and helpful.  The housekeeping staff did an impeccable job caring for our room.  And the hotel's manager is a terrific team leader who always did an outstanding job making our stay as perfect as possible. We highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting beautiful southern California.

Summary Heading: Very sketchy room neighbors, poor quality room
Summary: I chose this Inn because it's located near where I had a Cirque show ticket at the OC Fairground. As a solo female traveler, I was a bit concerned when assigned a room that was the farthest possible from the office. The room itself was defaced with pencil scribbles (done by a child) on the walls and doors and had, obviously, never been cleaned off. The neighboring rooms had sketchy people hanging around their open doors. Multiple people from the street came up on bicycles to repeatedly do deals.There was no working deadbolt on my door - only a slide latch. Someone tried to pop my door open the next morning while I was in the bathroom - the evidence being the popped slide latch.  Travelers beware!!!!!!

My only issue is that the front desk clerk described the room as being somewhere other than when it was, and just generally feeling on edge and in danger here. Literally just more lights, and more safety measures, NOT A ARMED SECURITY GAURD though.

I always stay here when I travel to the West coast.  I have stayed here over 20 times.  They are clean, courteous with a great location for So Cal activities.  They have free wifi with breakfast in the am.  Nice TVs and pool..  Very clean..   Peaceful and quiet..  Great variety of local restaurants.  I am here now...  Still a cool place to be...  CW

Summary Heading: Bed bugs, dirty, really not good.
Summary: The first room we were given was really in bad shape.  We took pictures.  Smelled bad, dirty, cigarette burns on bed, lots of small damages to sink, furniture, etc.  We went back to office and got room changed to one in better shape; not really clean, but more or less acceptable for the price. At the end of the day spent at the mall and dining, we were watching TV when I noticed a bug crawling towards me on the bed.  Good thing the sheets were white so it was easy to spot. A large one.  Fortunately I had some reading glasses and I used the lens to pin the bug down while we took pictures and called the office.  Google pics identified it as a bed bug.  A maintenance man came and verified, then scooped the bug into one of the plastic cups from the bathroom and took it away.  Where

I really enjoy staying on the second floor.  The rooms are very clean and safe.  The location of the hotel is really accommodating to many activities within the Costa Mesa area. It’s also close to the highway for easy access to bigger cities like Los Angeles or San Diego.

I'm not sure why there are so many positive reviews for this hotel.  Something looks fishy.  Pros: 1) right off the 405 2) free parking 3) free breakfast 4) free wifi  Cons: 1) The rooms are really old, and are in definite need of a remodel ASAP. 2) There is a really bad smoke smell in the room.

The staff were courteous, attentive and professional. The room was comfortable and clean. They Inn is in a great location with an abundance of restaurants, shopping and the beach nearby. I definitely will rent here again.

Room was pleasant, as was front desk. However we were in 242 and unfortunately there's a employee residing in the room next door that will offer female guests of the hotel money in exchange for sexual favors

I used them two times now for 2 different concerts at the OC Fair. Close to the fair and clean very nice people and continental breakfast in the morning.  I will use again for another concert as well. Also close to In n Out burger and Dennys and other restaurant good location.

It was my first spot to sleep in LA, was ok for that price. The cleaning could really improve. Also the service was kinda slow, but I was grateful they kept our bags a little while, until we changed locations. Also located in a good zone, lots of things to do nearby.  Yea and the breakfast should really really improve!

Place was always packed. Seemed like there was always a line every time I needed to go to the main office. It's an older spot, no frills. The place obviously needs a makeover, but the location was nice, and it is affordable for the area.

I grabbed a room at this hotel last minute. The check in was easy enough and also totally void of conversation. I was given a room on the back side of the hotel and upstairs. The room was basic and seemed clean. The hotel also shows noticeable wear and tear. I had a door that had obviously patched and painted over. The bathroom was also painted noticeably "around" the toilet. The paint color behind it was different.   It's right off the freeway and next to a In & Out. The morning breakfast is basically coffee and a roll or cereal.

Used to stay here more frequently but probably not again. Huge facility but old and deteriorating room.  Noisy near freeway.  Internet did not connect after an hour of struggle (signal not strong enough to reach all areas of hotel?).  Long wait at check in as the poor gal up front was alone trying to handle check in, complaints, problems all at once.  Owners might think of upgrading internet system and hiring more help.  Good location but, for business travelers, their inadequate internet is a deal breaker.  Good chain; stay at other locales frequently.  Stayed at this one twice with same problems.  Can't stay again until problems fixed.

I was disappointed that this was a three star Inn. There were roaches crawling on the bathroom counter and in the tub. The mattress was worn and thin very uncomfortable. The room was cold and had an odor,

We had stayed at this Vagabond Inn several years ago and had a nice visit. This time the good thing about this place is the Pool was very nice and the Front Desk Clerk was personable.   The bed was uncomfortable. When part of the sheet came off we felt ill seeing the stains on the mattress without a mattress topper. Breakfast was below mediocre at best. We will never stay there again.

Staff friendly, outside clean, room clean but in real need of some maintenance / remodeling. Beds old and uncomfortable, bathroom facilities showing age as well, stopper missing from sink, and signs of rust in the sink as well, TV very small. For the price (about half that of La Quinta) it served the need.

My daughter and I were traveling with other teenage girls and a few other adults to a nearby horse show. There was a room not far from ours that had several men staying in the room. There was a smell of marijuana coming from the room and they had their boxer shorts hanging on the rail near their door. We arrived late and had to walk by several times to unload our vehicle. Their door was wide open and it appeared there were about 5-6 men staying in a room with two queen beds. I called for a roll away bed and was told I needed to go back down to the office to present my credit card, even though I had checked in with my card only a few hours earlier. When I walked to the office, it appeared that some people may be taking long term or permanent residence at the hotel. I noticed

Check-In Time is 3pm. I arrived at 3pm and had to wait 90 minutes for them to have my room ready, despite being told it should be maybe 25 minutes. That's 90 minutes of vacation wasted when I could have been doing something else. Room was dingy, worn down, and disgusting, everything is stained. Had to kill a cockroach during dinner (fun!). Do yourself a favor and google "vagabond inn crime." Also, check the reviews on that other site, you know the one (it's rated 1.5 stars with numerous unsavory tales).

Had no ac in the room. Called to the office and they would do anything for us. The whole row had none. They told me leave in 5 mins and get 10% or 30 min and get 50% off. It was midnight! HORRIBLE!!!!

Summary Heading: Learn to take pride in your property!
Summary: Spend $20 and put up new drapes     Put blankets on the bed that don't have cigarette burns and tears in them.    Try to take a little pride in your property that was absolutely filthy and disgusting.   I stay at Hilton hotels for work..   For personal travel I've stated at many budget hotels and I've never seen anything so dirty.   This propert makes Motel 6 look like a luxury hotel.   Quite frankly I'd be embarrassed to ask for a review.   Maybe management needs to take a tour of their properties

Would not stay here again.  Beds were extremely uncomfortable and mattress creaked every time we moved.  Changed rooms after we checked in as room was not very well cleaned and Could not access wifi.  Second room had no refrigerator and safe was broken.  Had to request a hair dryer.  Staff was accommodating and it was quiet.

I was first given a smoking room, when I walked in I was immediately greated by cockroaches and nats. there was mold on the walls & the blanket on the bed had holes from cigarettes in it. when I brought this to the employees attention he simply said "you asked for a smoking room, correct?" making it clear he did not want to help. I was transferred to a non-smoking room that was cleaner than the first but I do NOT recommend staying at this hotel. left covered in bug bites still.

I stayed in June and July of 2016.  I was in town for business and was pleased with my stay.  The only complaint I had was with the cable/satellite connection.  The tv;s were useless due to poor reception.  Other than that, I was pleased with the service, clean rooms (except the old, dirty carpet), and location.

Summary Heading: The room was fill with smell of marijuana.
Summary: When we stepped in a room, it was so strong smell of Marijuana.  So, I requested to a manager to spray deodorizer and he did it for me.  But it was still strong smell.   I was with my dog too, so there was not so much option to change the room.

Pulled off the 405 in need of a hotel for the night. I guess we should have taken more notice of the unkempt reception area. It should have prepared us for the disappointment when we got to our room. Grubby, is a fair description. The furniture, electrics, bathroom all need updating. Really didn't want to walk barefoot on the carpet. 'It's only for one night, we're tired, it'll do.' - we hadn't seen the worst yet! As we settled for the night, our first unwelcome visitor ran down the wall. Cockroaches!  We spent a very unsettled night with the light on, in hope of keeping away the roaches. In the morning the receptionist just shrugged off our complaint.

Clean pool... but homeless was bathing near the jacuzzi. Room was clean. Staff was alright. Breakfast was pretty good. Lots of fresh fruit. Air conditioner worked. No big issues. Close to the freeway. Right next door to IN N OUT.

Hotel and staff were great, polite. Will stAy here every time from now on. Room was very clean, pool was clean met some great people here. Great hotel if you have pets. Very accessible to beaches and great shopping and restaurants.

Arrived at the motel and from the outside the place looks nice.The furniture in the room was dated and scratch up handles missing etc..but the worst part was the mattress you could feel the springs and was very uncomfortable and could not get to sleep. We stayed the night but checked out early 2nd night to go home.

This place is absolutely filthy. I stayed here a few years back and it wasn't so bad. The new ownership is Indian, and typically the hotels in this area ran by Indian families are clean in very warm. This hotel is filthy and there's zero pride of ownership in it. The shower area was dirty the carpets are stained everything smells like smoke and dogs, the pool area needs to be resurfaced chipping paint flaking, even the bananas at breakfast were rotten. Someone who either needs to redo this hotel or bulldoze it to make room for somebody with a little pride of ownership in Southern California. The hotel is very convenient to the freeway and the beaches and would make a great site for a real hotel. I would recommend using hotels.com or some other booking service to get another

Summary Heading: i suppose i got what I paid for...
Summary: it was cheap and that is where the positives end. The room smelled really bad like cigarettes. Our room was not upgrated, yet our friends room that was right next door was and we paid the same price. We left for the day and came back in the evening and our clean sheets were still very damp on the bed. So gross.

I booked this hotel for a one night stay thinking it would be a little step up from Motel 6.. I think I would have rated the Motel 6 higher.  The Vagabond did have a breakfast which M-6 did not but the "non smoking" room wreaked of cigarette smoke and the bed was classic rock hard.  The TV worked and it was only for a night.  I would stay at M-6 next time.

Summary Heading: Shortened my lifespan by a good 12 months
Summary: 25 min check in process where I hear another guest complain that there is no cord connected to the room telephone. My room stinks of smoke.  Furniture is badly stained. Sheets have light stains. Carpet is sticky. Snot on bathroom wall. Badly painted bathroom door frame. The strong smell of mold that was initially masked by the smoke smell becomes overpowering when trying to sleep.   Staff were friendly and trustworthy, there was little noise to wake me, the room seems to be free of bugs and they do have a pool which I did not try.

When we arrived the key card did not work. So anytime we needed to get into the room we had to go to the office to have them let us in. They said they would have it fixed the next day and didn't. Room was very musty smelling. I guess if your only sleeping there it isn't bad.

This establishment is infested with bed bugs. We found out the following morning with children having bites all over them and finding the bugs in the bed. Pictures were taken and a complaint was made with at first a 10% discount being offered. We had to incur the cost of cleaning everything we own, and fumigating our vehicle because we transferred all of our personal belongings back in it. I have since spoken to the manager who is treating this issue as if we had ants in the room. He said he has sprayed the room. But he has not gone to the length he needs to to be sure this problem is handled. Getting rid of bed bugs is no easy feat. DO NOT STAY AT THIS MOTEL. Not to mention the smell of marijuana every time we would step outside, a constant police car driving through the

My family (Mom and Sister, nieces and nephew) stayed here - 8/8/15. Bed bugs bit my niece on her arms, waste and shoulders. So much that there was blood on the sheets (see pics).  When brought to the housekeeping lady's attention, she did not seem to concerned. Basically said talk to the front desk. Management extended a 10% discount for the hassle. Police cruised parking lot all night. Other occupied rooms had Marijuana smoke exiting them. Activity at this hotel was less than family oriented.

AVOID! THE WORST!  Terrible, terrible terrible!  Room reeked of dog and cat urine.  The carpet was disgusting.  The bathroom was disgusting, moldy.  You can find a better room in the slums of TJ.  The health department should close this dump down.  How anyone can give this hole a decent review baffles me.

This motel has deteriorated and is no longer a place where our family will stay.  Between nonfunctioning lights, dirty carpets, poor cleaning, noisy neighbors and traffic our stay of two nights was too long.

This place looked as though a murder took place in the room and that only crackheads stay there. The furniture was sunk in. The curtains had to cigarette burns. I didnt ask for smoking but thats all they had. The bed sheets still had hair from a previous patron.

Reception was unwilling to let us check in even 30 min early so we sat in the car for an hour. Rooms were below average cleanliness. Overall not very satisfied with service or quality. Was very satisfied with my last Vagabond stay in Long Beach

The room was spacious we got a two queen bed room. The carpet was stain. The bathroom was worned out. The chair in the room was broken. Housekeeping wasnt done properly, even though the housekeepers were very nice, the carpet wasnt clean. They were pills on the floors and chips as for other things, luckily my infant doesnt crawl neither would i let her with that dirty carpet. The room even after cleaning smelled like cigarrete even though they are non smoking rooms. I was charged $1.00 a day for a safe thats in the room that i never used. Overall, i dont recommend this place to families.

Summary Heading: Not as bad as I thought
Summary: I read a bunch of the reviews and was VERY apprehensive until I called every hotel and realized we had vacationed during Spring Break and that everything was booked.  Ok...So this isn't The Ritz....It is a budget motel....We saw two small bugs that were ***NOT*** roaches, ticks or bedbugs...rather just a couple that buzz around outside lights.  It was old and needs refurbishing but it wasn't filthy and I buy and use lysol before getting too comfortable.  If you are on a budget...This place is fine...The staff was really nice.  No issues...we stayed in 261 by the road, and though it could be a bit loud....It was alright.  Would stay again..:)

Our non smoking room smelled heavily like cigarettes..we got something to eat and brought it back to the room and as we sat down to eat OUR ROOM HAD ROACHES..we opened the dresser only to find even more ROACHES INSIDE ... THIS PLACE WAS SUCH A FAIL..WOULD NOT RECOMMEND STAYING HERE

Summary Heading: Good things come in older packages...
Summary: Sometimes when we travel, we think older hotels may not be a great place to stay because of antiquated décor or furniture that looks like it belongs in the Civil War era. But the Vagabond Inn in Costa Mesa, CA (at the 405-South Harbor Blvd. exit), although a little bit older, is a really pleasant surprise!  The exterior of this privately-owned motel is clearly the result of pride of ownership. It's well-maintained, clean and welcoming. The small, but functional lobby under the porte-cochère also plays host to the free morning Continental breakfast and across the driveway is a patio area with a variety of vending machines, tables, chairs and a grill to make your long day better. Next to the patio is a large (heated) pool and Jacuzzi area that is meticulous. If you’re really

I enjoy staying at the Vagabond in Costa Mesa for several reasons.  The location is freeway convenient and close to John Wayne Airport, Newport Beach and a short drive to Disneyland and other area attractions.  The rooms are clean, comfortable, and affordable and they offer free Wifi, fresh hot coffee and a continental breakfast. But best of all, they have a lovely pool surrounded by tall swaying palm trees that make you feel like you're in your own desert oasis!

I stayed because they are pet friendly and ended up staying elsewhere the next night my room was absolutely disgusting! Filthy from top to bottom. I got out of the shower and was drying my hair in front of the sink and my feet were covered with black hair from the carpet.  Apparently they don't vacuum.  Mold on ceiling in bathroom. Han been painted in years. Just plain nasty. Spider webs all around front door and alot of creepy people that seem to be living there. Also I made a reservation online at 7 pm and they called me at 10:30 the same night to see if I was still coming. Why???  Never again!!! Rude on telephone when I called to early in the day to make reservation, she said we don't take reservations.  Ahhhhhh, so I just hope u have a room when I get there??? She also hung

We needed somewhere near the airport and this was the cheapest on the night, $60, but even that felt like way too much. On arrival the hotel looked nice, but the experience went downhill quickly after that. The man working at late night reception acted if he couldn't care less, he answered the telephone whilst you were talking to him and he took an age to actually assign rooms to people. Whilst we were in there, a guy checked out with his woman of the night wandering off in the distance. The desk assistant gave us the furthest room away, next to the freeway. Whilst walking down to the room at 11pm, transients were smoking something with hotel guests on the porch and youngish kids were running around the car park area unsupervised. The room itself was so awful, the electrical

We had booked for 3 nights but checked out after one and that was one too many !!  The carpet was filthy my feet got black just walking from bathroom- the curtains were falling down - the beds must be 20 years old - foul odor from old dirty carpet- on an on Could not get out of there fast enough !! Yuk

Summary Heading: OC Fair time, this is the place to stay !
Summary: I stayed for nearly a month during the OC Fair.  I have been doing this for they past several years.  The management and staff are great. I travel alone most of the time, but I feel safe and know I have a clean place to sleep every night.  I love the location right off the 405 Fwy, as well as, all the stores and restaurants that are close by.  Fresh coffee and a great pool area is definately a plus.  Did I mention the free WiFi !

Summary Heading: My stay at the vagabond in Costa Mesa
Summary: My stay at the vagabond has been a very good experience from the people to hanging out in the pool .every one here is very nice and kind .one really good thing I like about this place is that every thing you need is very close like walking distance I think that very awesome .plus the free breakfast is a plus just rite out your hotel room  .and the maids are very nice and helpfull for eny thing you might need they all ways help me with eny thing .i think this is a good place to bring your family for a weekend of fun in the sun .its been a great experience thank you

I really enjoyed my stay at the Vagabond Inn. It's centrally located to highway, restaurants and the state fair!! Great management team and the service is great. Rooms are also clean too!  I would recommend the Vagabond Inn to my family and friends!

To call this Place a flea bag is an insult to fleas and bags everywhere  Judging by the caution tape and the blood stains we might as well have been staying at the Bates Motel... Actually it might have been cleaner.   We checked into two pre-paid rooms booked through Orbitz, at check-in I was immediately charged an additional $20 room key deposit and a $30 room “upgrade” because even though I had paid for a room with two queen beds they tried giving me a room with only one.  If I wanted two I had to pay more. Nice…   Upon entering the first room (which was unlocked and standing wide open) the smell of mold and cigarettes permeated everything within its confines (even though this was a non-smoking room). There were crumbs, unidentifiable stains and hair on the sheets and a wad of

Seems like a good location for the OC... BUT, it was AWFUL!! Freaky people loitering everywhere, felt very unsafe. Got hit up for spare change on the stairwell. YUCK! Room smelled..  people in and out of rooms all night long. Nasty bed. Go anywhere else but here!

The property is relatively easy to get to. Average room type but clean.  The pool was adequate and there were plenty of food choices in the area. The upper level rooms seem to be more quiet than the ones on the first floor

I read a lot of really negative reviews about this place, but I had a really great experience. I stayed for 2 nights and I found my stay to be very pleasant, clean, quiet, and safe. Nothing bad to say here.

The place was clean, roomy enough, had fridge, microwave and simple breakfast. Staff was nice and accommodating. Price was reasonable and less than other like facilities. This is so close to lots of restaurants, including and In 'N Out burger in front of the inn.

Room was a good price and worked fine for the two of us to stay one night. Friendly and helpful staff. Ice machine on our side of the building was broken, so we had to walk all the way over to the far end of the lot where the lobby was to get ice. The red stir sticks in the wicker basket for the coffee all had brown coffee inside of them that was old and sticky so they'd obviously been used by the prior tenant of the unit.  The complementary lotion bottle was three quarters already used by the previous units tenant. I am not a very tall woman, and I had to almost get on my knees in the shower because the shower was not adjustable. It may have been adjustable at one point but it was stuck. There is a working television and refrigerator we did not use. The bed was hard but

I just needed a cheap place to stay near Newport after going out one night and I booked this hotel...One of the worst I have ever stayed in...The sink and vanity area had at least 200 cigarette burns on the counter...I didn't even feel safe with the door locked...I honestly put a chair to the door...There is a table and chairs in there but they looked like horrific so I did not even bother to sit down...I pulled off the comforter cause that was not going to touch my skin...I barely slept that night cause I just got creeped out...Honestly it reminded me of one of those places that criminals go to when they are running from the police...I can not make this stuff up...so if you ever watch a cop shows and they are at a 2 story motel yelling on a megaphone to come out with your hands

Summary Heading: One of the worst places that I have stayed!!!!!
Summary: I found this place last minute and had not read any reviews and wasn't happy about staying here but was exhausted from travel and desperate.  My room had a terrible smell, the bathtub and shower curtain still had dirt spots, dead spider in the bathroom, lampshade hanging from the ceiling over a lightbulb, large gap under entry door.  The doors and jams was all damaged.  I did not even take my shoes off to walk on the carpet and dreaded getting in that bed.  I was charged $110.00 for my stay.  Robbery to say the least.  To top it off my brand new car got scratched!!!

Summary Heading: Don't stay here unless you like ants everywhere
Summary: Warning: this hotel has a bug and cleanliness problem. We want to warn as many people as possible about this hotel. Our rate was $89/night + tax so our expectations were reasonable. We try never to compain and this is our first review post. Although the place is run down, we were willing to overlook any superficial issues until the ants, bugs, and dirtiness became too much for us. We needed to wear flip flops in the shower (shower shoes) because of the tub sanitation and uncleanliness. The "replaced sheets" were dirty, hair and filth everywhere, and the ants were in the bed (and all over). When the issues were brought to their attention, I was given a can of bug spray (raid). Unfortunately, this was a horrible experience.

DON'T STAY HERE! Why don't people read these reviews and take them seriously. This place is the filthiest place you have ever seen. It is broken down with broken windows and doors that don't lock right. You will need a shower after you leave there. I didn't look at the reviews before staying there so PLEASE do yourself a favor and pay a little more to stay elsewhere. Sleeping outside would be better. I don't know why the owners don't clean this place up. It really should be shut down. It is OFFENSIVE that the owners let it go like this.

From the get go this hotel stay was just awful.  Whoever owns and operates this place should be deeply ashamed of themselves.  Don't they have any pride of ownership?  How can they in good conscience collect money from people for such a NASTY place? The thing is that I read some decent reviews of it and I have stayed at other Vagabond Inns in other cities that were just fine.  They are budget for sure, but usually clean and comfortable.  And this hotel really looked good on the outside.  The pool area was pretty (until you got up close) and the registration office is quite nice.  And there are two young women who at the front desk that were really sweet.  I feel sorry that they are stuck in jobs at Hotel Hell. The first room they put me in had no working deadbolt.  I am a single

Summary Heading: Decent rooms, decent rates, nothing special
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for a little getaway/work related stay. Reading the other reviews on other sites, most complained about road noise. That really only applies if you get a room on the side by the freeway, its located literally right off the 405. We had a room on the opposite/street side, and it was relatively quiet. Aside from our neighbor constantly slamming their door and stomping past at all hours of the night, it was not a bad stay. The cable is limited, and there is no fridge/microwave, although we stayed in the basic suite. In-n-out is in the same parking lot, gas stations and Chick-fil-a is right across the street, the hotel itself is at a pretty good location, beach would only be about 25 mins away, possibly more with traffic but otherwise that's pretty darn good!

Summary Heading: cheap but still not worth it
Summary: Got this room on priceline for $45 plus tax.  Yes, it's cheap.  And no, I didn't expect much.  But even with my low expecatations, this place managed to disappoint.   I should have just paid another $10 - $20 and gotten a better room someplace nearby (like the Extended Stay America for example).    There was riff raff and thugs hanging out in front of their hotel rooms.  Most of the room (except for bed) looked run down, dirty, old, in need of replacement.  The AC hardly worked, my room was hot all night.  the front desk clerk ignored me when I walked in and greeted her (both on check in and check out).  She hardly spoke a word and never said thanks, your welcome, etc.  Clearly the staff here could care less about being friendly.  There was an RV parked in the parking lot with a

I stayed here for 2 nights after someone recommended it to me. The staff was great. The pool area was nice and there are places close by to eat. There is an In-N-Out Burger right next to the parking lot. The rooms are old and need of a remodeling. The first night we stayed in a room where someone had obviously made a smoking room out of a non-smoking room. The place smelled like cigars. Horrible! The carpet was very stained and all of the furniture was well worn. We put up with it because we got there late at night and just wanted to sleep. In the morning we told the staff at the front desk about the smell in the room and they were very helpful getting us a new room for the next night. The first new room we tried smelled so musty and like mold that we asked to change again. The

I posted this review a couple days ago, but don't see it displayed for others to see, which I think is very important.  This hotel has gone through some major upgrades since I lived in Costa Mesa 8 years ago.  That's the only reason we stayed.  But when we had an issue with bugs all over our bed, and were treated like we were by the management...I was furious.  The cleaning staff is very, very nice.  The pool is great...and the place has really been upgraded.  But, when your bed is full of bugs, and you try to get clean sheets in the middle of the night...it's a MAJOR problem for them...and we were told that WE must have put food in our beds!  Then, when you complain the next day about it...you are treated horribly...and that's a bad thing after not getting any sleep because

Starting with the pros, the management and staff of Vagabond Inn, Costa Mesa/Orange Co., CA couldn't have been nicer and more accommodating. The manager/shuttle driver was extremely nice and went to great lengths to make our stay there as nice as possible. The housekeeping staff was A+. They could have been working in the most expensive hotels. The room was cleaned daily, no matter what time we left the room. There were always fresh towels, soaps, shampoo, etc.--even a little animal made out of the washcloth. The front desk staff were also very nice. The price was unheard of! It was very economical for a room with frig, coffee pot, microwave, hair dryer. The pool was very pretty--not just you ordinary rectangular small hotel pool. It was shaped like Mickey Mouse! Nice hot tub
I've been staying here on Business. The manager and staff have been very friendly and accommodating. Good option for an inexpensive hotel.

Summary Heading: Great location, but not too clean
Summary: Stayed here 3 times ....the place is strange...the rooms on the other side are not as bad as the rooms closer to the freeway....appear to be a lot of homeless folks in the units, too.  Cheap rooms equal bad housekeeping and deferred maintenance.  A little quality control regarding cleanliness would make this place more attractive.  Kept thinking about bed-bugs after I saw the room...

I rent a room to finish my essey for school, my roomates decided to do a party at home. So i got the 60$ deal just during the day to stay in a quiet room. In front of the room has a baseball field!!! So the kids yelled the entire day!! When they finally finished the game, some kids with skates used the parking lot to pratice some moves. Great!! Not to mention the room is horrible with stains all over and smells soooo bad!! Thank God i didnt sleep there because i think ill be worst. Please stay away from it. Everything is bad in this place. You can hear the tv in the next room, people talking. Its just horrible.

Look, there are no bargains in hotels.  This is the cheapest inn in Costa Mesa, and it shows.  You can't control the temperature in your room.  In Fall/Winter/Spring, the vent blows hot air, and there is nothing you can do about it.  The place is filthy, and the service is poor.  But hey, it was cheap.
I was fully satisfied with everything. It is a nice clean place and everybody especially the manager is very friendly. This is why I decided to stay more than three months.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for.
Summary: Good points about this hotel. It was next door to an In and Out Burger It was close to the business meeting I was attending. Close to restaurants, grocery stores, and great access to the highway. Okay breakfast.  Cereal, muffins, juices.   Price is what you pay for.  Don't expect a lot and this will be okay to lay your head for the night.    Bad points. Room looked dingy due to the carpet stains and ceiling stains. Employee at check-in had a bad attitude.   Noisy due to traffic.

First off I have had several bad experiences at the Vagabond in Costa Mesa. I am even doing this report while using there Free WiFi that kicks you off about every 5-7 minutes, I can't do anything pretty much it cuts off my conference calls, internet phone calls, and everything that requires you to stayed connected for more than 5 minutes. That's just the internet. Its also winter time and its freezing in here and my 11 month son is with me I let him know the heater does NOT work and they said they turn it on at 11 p.m. after telling i have my 11 month son with me and at that they never turned it on! The main guy at the front desk has a bad attitude towards everything; and doesn't speak very much english. There's MORE... my phone has not worked  and they have not bothered to fix

Hotel was a good value for the price.  Beds were comfortable, TV was fine, restroom/ shower was clean.  We stayed two nights and they cleaned our room very well.  Nice location by the highway, close to fast food restaurants. Short, quick drive to the beach.

I complained and even asked for another room due to a lounge chair and ottoman with several stains. The second room had the same dirt and stains. The maintenance guy tried to replace it with another but even the replacement was stained. I could not believe any hotel would present disgustingly dirty and filthy rooms. The carpet was dirty with stains as well, walls and doors dirty with a window that did not lock so they put a wood bar in it. Could hear every car on the freeway as windows were old and not insulated. Few TV channels available and the remote was missing the back so held together by masking tape. I was put next to a very loud family who was yelling at their kids at 7am! There were plenty of empty rooms and the front desk chose not to spread customers out but should

I have been enjoying staying with the 'Vagabond Inn' chain up & down California, for years w/ no complaints.   I am a frequent Traveler therefore the perks the chain provide add a bonus 'incentive' (10th nite free) and have been consistently a good, solid econo-option.  Having to be in Costa Mesa over-nite on business, I decided to stop at the local VI.  Now, I wish I had slept in my car...!  1st of all, this property compared to other VI's I visit regularly, is a poorly-maintained dump.   Unkept inside and out, I couldn't believe the delapidated condition of the entire upper wing's interiors!  The doors had been left open to all rooms from housekeeping (to air out, my guess...)  In and out, I wove through each one, to select @ least 'one' decent room - NO luck!  Furniture run

Although this place is close to beach cities, I'll do my best next time to shop around.  pros - decent prices -exceptional continental breakfast cons -non smoking rooms aren't really non smoking. They smell like smoke and the scars of cigarette burns in the carpet show the truth.  -their "premium cable channels are a joke. you get like 10 channels  maybe (none of which are espn which is a big problem for me=)

Freeway close and also near plenty of restaurants and shopping.  Older, retro decor and feel. (ex; moss green shag-type carpet.)  Cozy property layout.  Generally very quiet. Comfy bed/pillows. Clean room and good maid service too.  Quaint, appealing pool area. Free continental breakfast. Fridge/microwave in room. Kind front desk staff. Suggestion: Bring a fragrant votive candle for your room to make it smell nice. My room had a musty smell, but it wasn't noticeable after I lit a candle.

It was OK but ...the carpet was so dirty that it made you feel very uncomfortable to even walk on it with shoes. It had huge stains...one looked black like auto grease and one looked red like blood. And it was extremely noisy.

Summary Heading: I checked right out as soon as I saw the room....wasn't sure what would crawl out at me during the night...
Summary: Room was terrible in every way!  Save your self the grief!

Summary Heading: What you reserve is not what you necessairly get!
Summary: Our reservation was for a room with a micro oven and fridge.  I told the very friendly desk guy that my room did not have these things in it.  He said my reservation for those things was only good if they had any left. Otherwise, good bed, quiet and clean except for the carpet.  I wish they had tiled floors like we find in Mexico all the time.

Summary Heading: Free Wi-Fi, close to Target & I-405
Summary: Check-In was easy and extremely fast, after about 10 minutes went back to the front desk to ask them for the code and they wrote it down for me, not the fastest but still a decent speed. The room was very clean, looked nice, bathroom was clean, we had more than enough towels, the tv size was okay, had hbo so I was able to watch boardwalk empire later that night. I loved the location, close to the 405, gas stations, target, and fast food places. I didn't bring a jacket because I though it wouldn't rain, the next day I was able to walk to target to buy one. On Harbor blvd the fenced lot before mickey d's smells like death, I couldn't walk on that side walk because the smell was so terrible. I needed a place between Anaheim and Huntington Beach, and I picked the right place.  I

Summary Heading: Zero Customer Service, Would Rather Stay in a Tent!
Summary: First thing is first...  My friend booked his room ahead of time and paid $110 for two nights.  When I checked in to get my own room, I was quoted $140 for two nights.  I had to "haggle with" the front desk employee in order to get a rate of $120 for two nights.  Second issue was the wireless internet.  I called the front desk three times to let management know that the internet was not working whatsoever.  There was a weak signal and pages would not load.  It was frustrating because the hotel's employee kept saying "My internet is working fine here at the front desk."  He did not make any attempt to fix the problem or address the complaint.  I was finally able to successfully get on the internet by using my laptop on the outside patio, by the front desk.  The signal worked

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel, Super clean, Great location, Awesome pool/spa
Summary: They FILL UP FAST so be warned, Plenty of parking even if you have a oversized truck with trailer. I stayed for work weekly and then had my wife come to stay for the weekends it was so relaxing. I will recommend this hotel.

I found that my room was dirty and not cleaned not made when I returned to the hotel late evening. I called the front desk and was told by the person at the front desk that they would call the manager. After having waited for about 40 minutes I went to the front desk to complain. I showed him the photograph of my room that I had taken with my cell phone.The response was that they do not have any service now and they were sorry. I was told that he would again contact his manager.  I returned to my room and the after about half an hour or so the manager called and offered to give me additional towel and said that service is not available and he could send a maintenance person to vacum my room, who would not do as good as a job as the cleaning maids. It was late and I had a

Summary Heading: Stay Away! Hotel is filled with prostitutes!
Summary: My husband and I reserved 8 nights at this hotel while renovations were being done in our home.  This turned out to be a huge mistake.  On our second night, while standing outside of our room (which was directly in front of the parking lot), I was propositioned by a man offering to pay me for sex.  I DO NOT look or dress the a prostitute.  This man repeatedly propositioned me for sex and would not leave after I asked him to numerous times.  I had to call the cops but by the time they got to the hotel the man was gone.  The officer then proceeded to inform us that the Vagabond in is notorious for prostitution and that there are a number of known prostitutes living in the hotel.  When we asked the manager of the hotel to move us to the interior of the hotel, away from the parking

My husband and I stayed there after I made the mistake of using Priceline's "Name your own price" which has worked out for me in the past, BUT this time.... not so much. I guess I do need to start off with the phrase, "You get what you pay for" because I only spent $50 total on the room. We wanted to stay out near Irvine because we were going to a concert and we live over an hour away. Anyway, the room smelled bad and musty, the decor was outdated and wore out, the sink had nasty build up all around it and the bed was not even close to be comfortable. My husband and I walked into the room and basically left about an hour later because I knew I did not want to sleep there. I guess this place would be good if you were a transient, but I definitely had to pass. My $50 went to

Summary Heading: Do Not recommend.  Watch your wallet here, folks.  Management likes to raise your rates without telling you. Smelly.
Summary: For business, we travel to a different city every week and usually choose hotels based on location. After a second stay with colleagues at this property, we ran into the same suspicious activity from the same manager that we had encountered a year earlier.  On our first stay, we chalked up our disapointment with the fact that everyone deserves a 2nd chance. However, it seems whenever the manager thinks the hotel will sell out (based purely on location as there are few hotels in this area) he will mysteriously raise your rate hoping you overlook the fact that you spent more money than was originally quoted and if you extend your stay he will quote you your same rate but charge you a higher rate on check-out claiming her never quoted your original rate.  Other guests experienced

Summary Heading: The worst Inn I had ever experienced
Summary: We booked  with prepayment via priceline.com We checked in around noon to get a room. 6 hours later, we came back and found they disabled our keys and not able to go into the room. After checking with front desk, the guy was very rude because we booked through priceline and saying we should not have got the room we had earlier. According to him, the room given to us by mistake and he forced us to a smaller room. The room we moved to was smaller and  very dirty .The window can be open from outside. The bed is bad it hurt my back when I lay down. The sheet has spot been burn.... The worst we had ever stay. We moved out next day even we had two night reservation.

Summary Heading: Good sleep located between Disneyland and Newport Beach/Huntington Beach by bus
Summary: The Vagabond Hotel provided restful sleeps, a great location. You can step to the Harbor Boulevard and take the 43 Bus (N) to Disneyland (Anaheim) or South to Newport Beach / Huntington Beach for great bike rides (miles). There is a laundry place, 711 and Route 405 a stones throw away. The Hotel is quiet with well maintained as are the grounds across the street. Hold on to that “Do Not Disturb” otherwise you will have the cleaners knocking on your door at reasonable times to do their work. The pool and Jacuzzi are fine as there are also nice places to sit with shade, breeze and flours. The staff is accommodating and I look forward to returning for the fine location and sleep.

After reading the other reviews of this place I decided we'd try it on an up coming trip.  What a mistake.  The rooms were not the cleanest, things didn't work AND worst of all the room next door had noisy people who sat outside smoking, drinking and swearing till 4AM (couldn't reach anyone on the front desk but don't know what they could have done about it anyway).  We saw 2 police cars coming out of the hotel parking lot when we booked in, perhaps that should have told us something!  Didn't feel a safe area at all.

Great place to stay. Beds are EXTREMELY comfortable. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Manager is a pleasure to speak to and is always willing to help. Pool and landscaping is absolutely beautiful. Rooms are tastefully appointed with micro/fridge, massaging shower heads and more. Very quiet and serene.Close to shopping, restaurants, and of course the beach. Anybody looking for a great room at a great price, this is it.

We got a good deal, for a walk-in.  We just needed a place to sleep after a night on the town.  Comfy beds, very spacious room, and pretty quiet, even with all the people around.  A good no-frills spot for rest.

Summary Heading: friendly staff , nice clean rooms , great stay
Summary: we stayed 4 weeks & i have no complaints. clean swimming pool & jacuzzi very courteous & friendly staff

I just wanted to give a general "You Guys Rock!" to literally EVERYONE who works there. Everyone there was super nice and unbelievably good at what they do, So I just wanted to give them a well-deserved Thumbs Up!  My parents had a room and my husband and I had a room. We asked to be close to each other and the hotel staff accommodated our request cheerfully. The hotel is beautiful and everything was clean. The staff handled special requests promptly. My favorite things: the beds (awesome), the pillows,  the lighted makeup mirror . Outdoor Pool is nice and pretty big and they have nice hot tub too. Most of all, the staff provided exceptional service! I will definitely stay there next time when i am in Costa mesa .

Summary Heading: Vagabond Inn is a really beautiful place to stay
Summary: Recently I had to wait six weeks for my new place in Costa Mesa to be remodeled so I decided to stay in a hotel. Living here I know very well Orange County but nothing about hotels, so I thought this was a good opportunity to try some of them in the area. A little bit for curiosity and also to have an inside to help visiting friends (I never know which hotel to suggest…).   Let me say this: Vagabond Inn is a really beautiful place to stay. It has been recently remodeled and it looks really great with POOL and JACUZZI heated until late night and with very charming illumination of the surrounding palms. The manager gave me 1 night free every 9 nights paid: that was a very good opportunity for me because, as I said, I wanted to try various hotels.   But he was right, because it

Summary Heading: Very Unsafe!!!  Worst Hotel I've Ever Stayed At!
Summary: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Usually when I travel I stay at a motel 6 because I am usally traveling with my dog.  This time my boyfriend and I decided to stay somewhere a little nicer with a pool and jacuzzi.  This was a big mistake.  I had booked the room for the entire week (I was there on business) and actually checked out after two days.  At check in the staff was unfriendly and the jaccuzzi didn't work.  Apparently there was a man staying there who had five rooms rented throughout the hotel. The police actually showed up to investigate. Prostitution...?  The walls are paper thin and there is was no possibility of getting a good nights sleep.  The second night we were there I was awakened by the sound of a woman screaming and banging on the door next to

Summary Heading: horriable  hotel  to spend your money!!!!!
Summary: Where do I start when we arrived all seemed well. Okay customer service not friendly but not rude either they just checked us in and on to our room. This room gives the meaning of looks can be deceiving looks good but the TV the cable reception horrible only few channels. It's not summer yet but sure feels it and their is no air conditioning at all just hot air blowing from the vent half of the hotel has their doors open. We called front desk they just brought us a fan that is also broken only goes one speed it was a joke. To make our stay even more of a nightmare the two ice machines the first machine no ice and the second machine you need to pay $0.50 and it kept the money and no ice. We gave up on front desk asked for any discount at checkout for all of this and wouldn't give

We moved over here from the Motel 6 across the street because we wanted a bit more comfort. We used to live in Costa Mesa so were visiting friends. THE POOL AND JACUZZI ARE HEATED. This was a great feature. Nice place outside to lounge and free breakfast (Cakes, croissants and fruit) with all day breakfast. We booked online with the Vagabond site and paid $65 midweek (before tax) and $69 at the weekend. Stayed for 11 nights and so got tenth free making it only marginally more than the Motel 6 (cold miserable pool, noisy aircon).  Very friendly, clean place. Quiet (we had a room overlooking Tewinkle School). If you are a runner its a short way down Giseler to the Santa Anna river trail - go towards the beach and a big nature reserve is on the left - beautiful. 4 miles down is the

Summary Heading: I give this place two thumbs up!
Summary: I am staying here at The Vagabond this week, for an ongoing project in the area. Clean rooms, friendly people at the front desk, visible manager. Who could ask for more!?!

My wife and I stayed here on a Friday night. I booked a Queen room online the day before at $89, but when we checked in the clerk offered us a King. I said no no, we don't need a King at additional cost. He clarified that the King would be $79. We took it.  When asked whether we wanted to be upstairs or down, I joked that I didn't like being below a 300 pound guy clomping around upstairs. He took me seriously, promising not  to book anyone directly above us, and apparently kept his word.  The room was plain and clean, with a microwave, refrigerator, iron and ironing board, a coffee pot and a safe. We used only the coffee pot. The Expedia site says this is a "contemporary" hotel. Hardly. As other reviewers have noted, it's older, but still OK. Even so, there were no grab bars in

Summary Heading: Really bad experience, unwilling to help
Summary: We had a really bad stay. Before coming, the Motel assured us their internet connection was working but it was in fact not. They did very little to help and we could never talk to the manager. This made me miss an inmportant deadline for a conference. When we kindly asked to talk to the coorporate office (since the manager would not talk to us) they told us they would charge the phone call to our bill to make it even worse.  We were very polite all along, but the Motel staff did nothing to help us.   If you are looking for a hassle-free stay at a motel, don't go to this motel.  Best of luck with your travels!

Summary Heading: Don't stay at their hotel unless you have no other choices
Summary: I am searching for a hotel/motel near UCSD on the night of 4/10/06.  Found Vagabond Inn (about 10-15 mins) from campus.  Made reservations for $79 excluding taxes (via phone).  Two days later, I was searching on the Internet and found the same motel on travelnow for a lower price at $65 for the same type of room -- 2 queen beds; non-smoking.  I called the motel to ask that they honor the rate.  The clerk (or is it the owner?) asked where I saw it online.  Told him where to look so he won't think that I was making it up.  He put me on hold for about 5 minutes and came back to tell me that he didn't find the website (yeah right!).  He gave me a bunch of lame excuses why he couldn't honor it, etc...  I told him that since he can't honor it, I can alway make the reservations online
Good for a short 1-3 night stay, not for romantics or couples, but served its purpose for me.

This hotel is ok for a short stay. I prefer a 4 to 5 star hotel but decided to try a cheap inn/motel since I planned on being at the beach all day.  The room was cheap yet very clean.  The location is right off I-405 and about 5 minutes from Newport Beach/Balboa Pier.  There are plenty of restaraunts and major retailers in the area.  If you are looking for a good economy inn/motel for a cheap getaway....you'll be satisfied with this Vegabond Costa Mesa. Remember you get what you pay... so no fancy furniture or  wet bars will be in the room... just the basics.
